definition: the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: Took back-to-back to more distant light years.
sentences.chinese: 毅然背对背走向更远的光年。

sentences.english: The test consisted of back to back rides the same trails using both forks.
sentences.chinese: 测试构成背对背游戏机相同的路径，使用叉子。

sentences.english: The two of them are sitting on the grass back-to-back, no one is speaking a word.
sentences.chinese: 他们两个背对背的坐在草地上，谁也不说话。

sentences.english: Finally, Liu and Xiao Yu went to the Internet cafe and they were still back to back this time.
sentences.chinese: 最后，刘冰和小雨又去网吧上网聊天，依然是背对背。

sentences.english: You and I began to walk apart, back to back.
sentences.chinese: 我和你背对背开始往前走。

sentences.english: There were two naked girls seated back to back on a dais thing.
sentences.chinese: 有两个光屁股姑娘背对背坐在一个类似台子的地方。

definition: to help lift up onto one's shoulders/to stand on sb's shoulder
to sit on the ground or the floor (idiom)
